result.execSummary:
The defendant Aymal A Garry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: In the House of Correction (HOC)/ Day Reporting Center (DRC), consecutive to any sentence, with credit for 3 days time served.  Huber privileges under Sec.303.08 Wis. Stats. to apply for work and inmate work assignments. No electronic monitoring.

miscConds.notes: Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision and DNA fees during the period of probation.  Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
Maintain full time / part time employment and or schooling.
As a convicted felon Defendant shall NEVER be in possession of any firearms/weapons/ammunition/magazines at any time in the future.

No new law violations reaching to the level of probable cause for finding.
No contact with anyone associated with a gang.
No association with drug users, drug dealers, drug houses, or drug dealings.

Cooperate with agent.
Comply with child support orders.
Comply with a paternity actions.
Complete a parenting and fatherhood classes.
Defendant required to provide a biological specimen (DNA) to the State Crime Lab.
Defendant can't vote in any election until civil rights are restored.

AODA assessment with follow up treatment.
Absolute sobriety.
Random urine screens with no positive results.
Court will consider expungement if Defendant successfully completes all conditions of probation with no new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding.

timeConds.notes: with Huber privileges for work, or inmate work assignments without good time credit and no electronic monitoring. Court IMPOSED AND STAYED the condition time pending a Probation Review Hearing in Branch 17 on 11-16-2015 at 01:30 pm.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Aymal A Garry

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Aymal A Garry in court. Brandon WIgley on behalf of Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
 Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed for agennt to request.  Court found that further review is not needed.
Dept of Corrections - Probation Review Hearing Report from agent Bonack received and filed.

Statements made as to Sentencing by both counsel and Defendant.

Defendant sentenced to serve 9 MONTHS, in the House of Correction (HOC)/ Day Reporting Center (DRC), consecutive to any sentence, with credit for 3 days time served.  Huber privileges under Sec.303.08 Wis. Stats. to apply for work and inmate work assignments.

Court IMPOSED AND STAYED the sentence and placed Defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 Months
with the following conditions as to probation:
*  No new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding.
*  Cooperate with agent.
*  NO ELECTRONIC MONITORING.
*  Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision and DNA fees during the period of probation.  Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
*  Maintain full time / part time employment and or schooling.
*  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
*  AODA assessment with follow up care and treatment.
*  Random urine screens with no positive results.  No association with drug users, drug dealers, drug houses, or drug dealings.
*  No contact with anyone associated with a gang.
*  Comply with child support orders.
*  Comply with a paternity actions.
*  Complete a parenting and fatherhood classes.
*  Defendant required to provide a biological specimen (DNA) to the State Crime Lab.
*  As a convicted felon Defendant shall NEVER be in possession of any firearms / weapons / ammunition / magazines at any time in the future.
*  Defendant can't vote in any election until civil rights are restored.

CONDITION OF PROBATION:  COURT SENTENCED Defendant to serve 45 DAYS at the House of Correction (HOC) with Huber privileges for work, or inmate work assignments without good time credit and no electronic monitoring. Court IMPOSED AND STAYED the condition time pending a Probation Review Hearing in Branch 17 on 11-16-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court will consider expungement if Defendant successfully completes all conditions of probation with no new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding.

Received and filed with court:
*  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief Form
*  Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement Form

Defendant Aymal A Garry in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found Defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction. Parties are prepared to proceed with Sentencing.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report dated August 11, 2015 received and filed. tk
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw
This assignment is only effective as of 8/3/2015.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Konkol.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Stark, Br. 17.

Defendant Aymal A Garry in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel has no motions to be filed.  Court advised parties that as of August 3, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Daniel Konkol, Branch 44 in Room 316 of the Safety Bldg.  Substitution filed.  Case assigned to Judge Stark.  Court contacted Judge Stark's clerk for the next court date.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 8/12/2015 at 1:30 pm, branch 17, in room 310 of the safety building.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  aw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant Aymal A Garry in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State has filed a motion for protective oreder pursuant to WIS. Stats. 971.23(6).  Order signed and filed.  State has turned over all discovery to defense, and has provided an offer in this case.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 7/8/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription. aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Aymal A Garry in court.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for scheduling.  Attorney Devitt is at a funeral, and unable to appear.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 6/8/2015 at 1:30 pm, branch 3.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant Aymal A Garry in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Zachary Wittchow.
Defense counsel needs discovery and a offer.  State to provide.   Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 6/1/2015 at 1:30 pm, branch 3.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
Court ordered defendant to be monitored by Drug Testing
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  
Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. 
Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.

Defendant Aymal A Garry in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Defendant Aymal A Garry in custody.  
Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
Scheduling conference scheduled for May 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
